;During the day from October 20 to 26, 2023, at the entrance of the Bengwan Theater in Xizha, Wuzhen, there was always a queue waiting to watch the show. The queue can sometimes stretch to the river. In September, free tickets for online reservations for the Wuzhen Theater Festival Youth Performance Competition (;hereinafter referred to as the "Youth Competition";) will be available at the beginning of the ticket sales It was robbed. This is one of the most important units of the Wuzhen Theater Festival every year, and it is also the only competition unit. Among the works of 18 groups of young dramatists, the Small Town Award for Best Drama, Best Individual Performance Award, and Special Attention Award will be determined.

;

;There is a sign in front of the fence outside the Bengwan Theater, indicating that ⅩⅩⅩ spectators can be admitted for this youth game. In the theater, the works of 18 groups of young dramatists were performed in turn; a screen was temporarily hung on a stone wall outside the theater for audiences who were unable to enter to watch the live broadcast. Under the scorching sun, there were always five or six rows of enthusiastic audiences sitting on the floor.

;

;Since 2013, the Wuzhen Theater Festival has been running for 10 years, and the Youth Competition has also been running for 10 years. Bengwan Theater is named after the earliest place name here. Huang Lei thinks it is good, "There are many clams in Bengwan, and each clam may hide a wonderful pearl."

;

;Wuzhen Theater Festival One of the initiators, actor Huang Lei, who has taught at the Beijing Film Academy for many years, has "deep gratitude" and "profound reflection on the shortcomings" of traditional art education. He brought some ideas that could not be implemented in school to the Wuzhen Theater Festival. This year, two days before the opening of the 10th Wuzhen Theater Festival, in a handwritten letter to the youth competition, Huang Lei wrote, "In the beginning, when the Wuzhen Theater Festival was just a small idea, young people were already fans of this festival. The protagonist, the origin and goal of everything is for the young people."

;

;The Youth Competition is open to young people who are interested in engaging in the theater industry. The rules are very simple: each of the three founders of the Wuzhen Theater Festival will bring a prop to form the group. The annual proposition - use these 3 props to rehearse an original play with no more than 5 people in 20-30 minutes.

;

;In May this year, Huang Lei, Lai Shengchuan, and Meng Jinghui, the founders of the Wuzhen Theater Festival, proposed the topic for the youth competition: world-famous paintings, train tickets, horses. "The fundamental purpose of the three props is not to test how you use the props, but to test how you use the environment, find effective stage fulcrums, and maximize the energy density of the play per unit time." Youth competition judge Li Bo said. In August, more than 500 works were submitted; in September, 18 groups of shortlisted works were announced; in mid-October, the group lottery for performances at the Wuzhen Theater Festival was released.

;

;The stage of Bengwan Theater is small and the layout is simple: ceiling light and curtain. The audience formed a semicircle, surrounding the stage.

;

;The small stage of Qingsai has produced many theater people over the years. In 2013, "Baba Mama" directed by Chen Minghao won the first prize. This year he is well-known to the public for his performance in "The Long Season"; in 2015, Wu Bi won the Best Drama Award for "Stillness". This year he is also a judge of the Youth Competition , is also an actor in Lai Shengchuan's new drama "Long Alley". Wu Bi once said that Wuzhen was the biggest turning point in his career. "You can have no cost and nothing, but you can do what you want to do and give everyone a stage for so many people to watch."

;

;;

;

;Wuzhen Theater Festival Youth Competition Unit Judge Li Bo;(provided by interviewee/picture);

;

;Li Bo participated in the first three Youth Competitions as a contestant, and his works all entered the top three. From the fourth time, he became one of the judges of the Youth Competition, responsible for selecting 18 groups of shortlisted works from hundreds of works; and then selected from the 18 groups. There will be 6 sets of final works.

;

;When he was in his early 20s, Li Bo studied in the Performance Department of Beijing Film Academy and enjoyed freedom and romance in the ivory tower. Later he became a university teacher. "I always felt that I had no goals and no outlet, so I was very confused." Participate The Wuzhen Theater Festival has directional significance for him. He said that it is a way for more people to understand his theatrical concepts.

;

;During the 10 days in Wuzhen, I spent a lot of time at the Bengwan Theater. From these youth plays, I can see the disappearance of love between men and women, the love between mother and daughter, and father and son. The hidden pain caused by the bondage, and the individual's reflection on the tearing of the world.

;

;The story of "Fifth Floor, Ninth Floor", which won the Best Drama Award, is set in a malfunctioning elevator. For half an hour, a boy on the fifth floor and a girl on the ninth floor reflect on their intimate relationship. , one feels that he is trapped by his boyfriend, and the other may be trapped by his girlfriend. They all wanted to run away and take imaginary train tickets to the north to see the auroras.

;

;;

;

;Stills of "Fifth Floor and Ninth Floor";(Provided by Wuzhen Theater Festival Organizing Committee/Photo);

;

;"Clam and Pearl" won the Special Attention Award and the Best Individual Performance Award. The protagonist is a very controlling mother. With the help of a psychologist, she reveals the trauma of being violated as a girl. At the end, the daughter takes a photo of her mother, and the mother looks back and turns into a picture of "Girl with a Pearl Earring."

;

;"Me and Liu Hongmei at the Station", which also won the Special Attention Award, has only one actor from beginning to end. "I" left the big city and returned to his hometown to become a staff member of the amusement park carousel project. We met several times. "She" (;grandma who has lived her whole life in her hometown;), when she was 15 years old, she wanted to secretly go swimming in the river; when she was in her twenties, She wanted to go to Beijing and Shanghai, and she cried anxiously when she lost her train ticket; she was 82 years old, thin, silent, and old, and time passed quickly on her; in the end, "I" took the 6-year-old "she" everywhere Carousel.

;

;;

;

;Still photo of "Liu Hongmei and I were at the Station";(Provided by Wuzhen Theater Festival Organizing Committee/Picture);

;

;One night during the drama festival, Li Bo queued up to watch Meng Jinghui's new play at the Zhenshui Carving Hall, and heard an audience member complain about a certain Qingsai play. Li Bo found it quite interesting. This just reflects the diversification of the youth competition standards. "It is true that the audience has mixed reviews of that play, but it is the only one-man show performed in this way on the youth competition stage in the past 10 years. We must encourage it, maybe in the future It will form a unique style. Young people should do a lot of exploration in their plays. If the plays are done very neatly, then it is Teacher Lai, right?"

;

;;

;

;This Youth Championship Finals The crew of the shortlisted work "Open the Unopenable Window" took their final bow;(Southern People Weekly reporter Zhang Yuxin/picture);

;

;After the finalists were announced and After the theater festival, Li Bo was interviewed twice by Southern People Weekly. The following is Li Bo's dictation:

;

;Qingsai is a school that allows you to have cute flaws

;

;;On October 26, we discussed the 6 shortlisted plays, and we wanted to take an official photo of the judges discussing the finalists. We all sat upright, holding the play review list. Later, someone came up with a point. Director Cheng Er was the first to stand up and said, no, this stage is so rare, this play must use the language of drama. Later, they all stood up and argued: what is reverence for the stage, what is the language of drama, how to perform in a small theater, how to use the three props, what to do if the performance times out...;< /p>;

;;There are more than 500 works registered, and we have to take care of a variety of themes, styles, and expressions. ;

;

;;Qing Sai is a school that allows you to have cute flaws. However, the dramas that were shortlisted for their flaws at the time were almost out of shape on the youth competition stage. ;

;

;;There is a play, the registration deadline is August 20th, I think they recorded it on August 19th , it’s too late if we don’t record it again. The video was taken at a piano store, and the first shot is still shaking. What they were performing was a light comedy, and the actors had to be absolutely relaxed. They probably acted as if they were not shortlisted. They came across a lot of spiritual and advanced comedy lines on the scene, so the ear guide team brought this up to the scene. . I was having a meeting out of town and was really bored, so I just put on headphones and watched the video. They were presented in a relaxed and playful way, and I was particularly happy to see them. The actor forgot his lyrics and laughed loudly, and so did I. ;

;

;;The finalists were announced later. The organizing committee called, signed a confirmation letter, designed a poster, and went to Wuzhen. Arrange three public rehearsals, an interview, a few more rehearsals, and then three rounds of performances. They began to realize that this was a competition and became nervous. When people are nervous, they become unfree. ;

;

;;The official Weibo announced the finalists, and there was a message saying that each of these six plays Solid, congratulations to them. This evaluation is the greatest encouragement for our work. Some plays may look good and rich, but they are too fluttery and tasteless at first glance; some may look steady, but the whole presentation has a poise that is rare for young people. ;

;

;;This year is the highest overall level I have seen in the 7 years I have been a judge. This year, we can really choose 6 out of the 6 finalists. In the end, we are making a choice. It happened that I came across a play that I liked very much, but some judges didn't like it very much, so the two of us kept arguing, but this was academic and not personal. When I work in an office, I tend to answer "yes" and "yes, you are right", but this problem does not exist at the Wuzhen Theater Festival. Teacher Lai and I also argued about it. ;

;

;;This year’s props are a horse, world-famous paintings, and train tickets. In addition to performance and text, the most important thing is to see how the three elements are used, because this game is supported by three elements. When we judge, if the performance of the two plays is similar, we will look at the props. Each of the three teachers was given a prop to prevent them from adapting old works. ;

;

;;The use of props particularly tests the professionalism of a crew. For example, we were fighting without a winner, and a knife suddenly appeared, and everyone wanted to grab it. This knife caused a turning point in the drama and changed the direction of the drama. This is a relatively common usage. ;

;

;;As for the props, I only mention it. This is the simplest; it also plays a role in the turning point of the play. Key role? Or is it an image and symbol that lingers in your mind throughout the play? These are three completely different levels. ;

;

;;The most difficult props this year are world-famous paintings, because we Chinese rarely have the experience of going to art exhibitions . Some of the plays are parodies of "Girl with a Pearl Earring", some have her family treating her works as world-famous paintings, and some have actors imitating "The Scream", all of which are quite cute. ;

;

;;"Liu Hongmei and I were at the Station", all of us judges passed the finals. I think its entry into the finals is inseparable from the use of props. The image of horses is present throughout. When we learn acting, whether props serve as the fulcrum of the stage or are key items that promote the development of the plot, they must appear on the stage, but they did not appear in this play. The script mentioned the carousel game. "I" walked around the stage like a merry-go-round and met "my" grandma. Every time I walked around, "I" saw Liu Hongmei in different stages. It all happened. Different things are related to Liu Hongmei's fate. Finally "I" returned to work and drove the merry-go-round for other children. So fresh, so natural. ;

;

;;

;

;The performance of "Then Tide, Sun, Moon" has ended;(Southern People Weekly reporter Zhang Yuxin/picture);

;

;Don’t be cool or showy, just focus on the story

;

;;I also said at the reading meeting that day that you can get chicken soup with 140 characters on Weibo, and you can achieve all your desires in one minute on TikTok. Why would someone waste two hours of their life in the theater to go to the theater? First of all, this play must have warmth. Second, the things you talk about in your play are things you don’t often see on Douyin, Kuaishou and Weibo. You need to lead the audience to pay attention to people in life that we have never paid attention to. ;

;

;;Up to now, I have selected one play in the previous youth competitions, and I think it is the best It is "Gama" in 2016 (Reporter's note: The title of the Youth Competition that year was A Drop of Blood, a Suitcase, and a Shooting Star. The protagonists of "Gama" are a mother and daughter. For many years, my mother has been unable to let go of leaving home to practice medicine. , the father who became a living Buddha, the living Buddha is dead, and the mother firmly believes that the living Buddha can be reincarnated and return home within 49 days, and hopes that her daughter Karma will be pregnant; but the child that Karma was pregnant with was the reincarnation of Kelsanghua, and the child also died. The mother The two women planned to go on their own pilgrimages and finally reconciled on the way to the sacred lake). Two graduate students from the Shanghai Theater Academy made it the only time in the history of the youth competition that the best individual performance award and the grand prize were all given to a team. When performing beliefs on the stage, they usually tend to be complicated, but that play was very simple, with one chair and two girls. One of the girls played two roles (the grandmother who never forgets her husband, and the reincarnated granddaughter of Kelsanghua). ), so simple yet so clear. After they kowtowed, they looked into the distance and saw a cold light coming over them. Wow, it was a lake. Tibetan music sounded, and it felt like we were in the snowy plateau. ;

;

;;From the first to the present, all the dramas that have won the grand prize are small and big. Talk about life down to earth. If you pick up a random person from Xizha, they can understand it even if they are over 10 years old or under 90 years old. ;

;

;;The stage of the youth competition is very close to the audience. Really, it is the most important thing. Is the core of your drama told to us through a small incident, or is it a fake philosophical event? I especially don't like to tell us something in a pretentious manner, or forcefully instill something. Including the judges' votes, the results of this kind of drama are not good. Young people's dramas don't need to be so complicated. Let's discuss To be or not to be. I'm sorry, you really don't have that skill. Sometimes what you think and what you perform are two different things. I still hope that the story can be told clearly: it has the story's ups and downs, characters, conflicts, and themes. Even if there is no intention, it is very rare. ;

;

;;Look at Liu Tianqi's "Chicken and Rabbit in the Same Cage" (Reporter's Note: Youth Competition Best Drama Award Award-winning work) How simple, the son went to prison to visit his father, and the two had a conversation. There is a big world in a small play. ;

;

;;I still think that young people don’t need to be cool or showy, they should be down-to-earth and focus their energy In terms of story, how to structure and unfold the story; the performance must be restrained. I especially hate the kind of badass performances that can be seen in short videos, but many people may be affected and feel that our scenes must be "acting". I told the contestants in the youth competition that it is the most difficult to act in a scene where the inner world is turbulent and the outer surface is as calm as water. When Marlon Brando, Robert De Niro, or Al Pacino encountered something that shattered his faith, was any one of them howling? His emotions are a reservoir, and as much as he wants can come out. ;

;

;;We also need to learn this on the stage. The performance must be subtle, restrained, and forbearing. Don't let the audience's shouts and applause make the play fly away and take over the show. Some plays were very popular, but we felt that they were a bit pleasing to the audience. After performing it once, we knew which baggage was in which place, but the second time we performed it with all our strength, without even control or rhythm. "Liu Hongmei and I were at the Station" is particularly stable and does not cater to the audience. ;

;

;;It is not easy to perform a one-man show. One person has to interpret many people. ;

;

;;We watched the registration video and there were a lot of one-man shows. A lot of it is like what we did when we were in school - a person encounters a dilemma within a unit of time, and through the struggle between people and the natural environment, the problem is pushed to a certain climax. But we should show new and real things to the audiences who come to Wuzhen. We have selected three one-man shows this time, such as "Liu Hongmei and I were at the Station", which are not one-man shows in the traditional sense. They are more often talking and revealing, in a particularly dull state, but the inner feelings are There is content. ;

;

;;I think the Bengwan Theater and Qingsai Theater in Wuzhen are an experimental field for young Chinese dramatists. As long as you have the ability, you can put your own experiments on the stage. The audience is tolerant, and so are our judges. ;

;

;;

;

;Outside the Bengwan Theater, posters of all the works of this youth competition are pasted on the gray stone wall;(South People Weekly reporter Zhang Yuxin/picture);

;

;If we don’t do drama, of course we can understand

;

;;When I was 33, 34, and 35 years old, I participated in the Youth Championship as a player. It was very unforgettable and worthwhile. In the first year, I did the only comedy among the 12 plays; in the second year, I did the only physical drama, without lines; in the third year, I did the only montage drama, relying on light to explain the performance. Now I am still a teacher, but I definitely can’t rule out things like those three years. People’s experiences are getting richer and their courage is getting smaller and smaller. Especially when working in a university, your imagination is not so wild. ;

;

;;In the first year of the Youth Voting Competition, we waited in line at school until two or three o'clock every night. The students were lined up to give up, saying that the standards of these judges must be high and they would not be shortlisted. I said, after being a teacher for so many years, I have also done scientific research and participated in awards. A competition that does not charge an entry fee must be a good competition. ;

;

;;I teach at a second public school, and students are recruited from the same school as Nortel Chinese Drama. There is a gap. The "survival rate" of my first class of students competing together is very high. One is in Happy Twist, one is in Dalian Repertory Theater, and one is now a delivery anchor. He is doing very well. I have seen his Live broadcast, his live broadcast skills are linked to his performance. He can hang up and smash up. Rather than watching his live broadcast, it is better to say that he is watching him perform a play. ;

;

;;I also rehearsed plays in college and Wuzhen plays. Sometimes one brain can be divided into two types ideas. All universities in China are actually the same, and university education has university characteristics. Therefore, when young people get the props from the Wuzhen Theater Festival, they may be very excited because they finally have the opportunity to make a comedy, tragedy or absurd play that they really like and have a sense of life. Let me put it in a very unpleasant light, Wuzhen's drama does not mean that after you perform in Wuzhen, you can perform it every day. If you win a grand prize in just 10 days, the chance of it being performed (continued) is very small. Some of the plays are very immature, but because the scenes are grand enough, they continue to be performed. ;

;

;;I still encourage young people to go to drama festivals to watch plays and compete. Drama lovers from all over the country come together in one place to talk about drama. This kind of preciousness is something that will linger in your mind for the rest of your life. ;

;

;;The goal of the Wuzhen Theater Festival is very clear. By capturing 5% of the people, this theater festival can manage. There is no way for us to have a chain of support like some film festivals, providing money to film, screen, and go online. Drama is still a niche, and the number of screens across the country is definitely much greater than the number of theaters. But we just want to give them a shot in the arm. Every year in the audience of the Wuzhen Youth Championship, there are contestants who were shortlisted in previous years. Those who did not vote this year, or who did not win, return to Wuzhen to watch the show. ;

;

;;Everyone has his or her own life choices. Of course we can understand if we don’t do drama, because It's good to be alive. If you're going to make a drama, make it a good one. ;

;On November 22, 2023, the official website of the Ministry of Education announced matters related to the 2024 National Master’s Degree Admissions Examination. According to statistics, the number of applicants for the national master's degree examination in 2024 is 4.38 million, a decrease of 360,000 or about 7.6% from the 4.74 million applicants for the postgraduate examination in 2023. This is also the first time in eight years that the number of applicants for the postgraduate examination has increased compared with the previous year. fall back.

;

;Why has the number of postgraduate entrance examinations declined? The outside world has summarized some possible reasons: some graduates turned to the public entrance examination, striving to get an iron job in one step, and withdrew from the postgraduate entrance examination track; some graduates no longer regard the postgraduate entrance examination as a choice, thinking that it is just a matter of paper. A postgraduate diploma may not necessarily lead to a good job, so it is better to enter the job market in advance to save opportunity costs; the postgraduate recruitment policies of major universities have changed. "The number of places for professional masters has increased and the number of places for academic masters has decreased", which has reduced the cost-effectiveness of postgraduate studies, and some prices Sensitive candidates give up in the face of high tuition fees.

;

;It is not difficult to see that these reasons all stem from the rational choices of candidates as "economic people": studying has increasingly become an investment, and the consumption attribute of higher education is also strengthening. If the candidates believe that studying for graduate school cannot improve the competitiveness of the job market and cannot bring good economic returns in the future, then the candidates will rationally consider "whether studying for graduate school is worth it", thereby reducing the "supply" of the higher education market. There is a rumor going viral that a famous postgraduate entrance examination teacher successfully predicted the decline in the number of people taking the postgraduate entrance examination. In fact, this also shows that his "preaching" over the years has achieved certain results.

;

;From a statistical point of view, the change in candidates' attitudes has also taken several years, which is essentially a "reverse incentive" brought about by changes in the job market. Statistics on the number of applicants for postgraduate entrance examinations over the years show that this number declined in 2014 and 2015, but has shown an upward trend since 2015, reaching a peak in 2023. The year-on-year expansion of postgraduate enrollment and the increase in the number of graduates have made the job market supply unable to keep up with the employment demand of graduates. This imbalance in supply and demand has naturally been transmitted to the upstream higher education market.

;

;It should be admitted that in reality, only a small proportion of people go to graduate school to satisfy their personal enthusiasm for knowledge or for scientific research. Most students go to graduate school for employment, which can be subdivided. Further studies to postpone employment, and "gold-plated graduate school" for better employment. Unfortunately, both of these options are facing great challenges amid a weak job market. Of course, students are not fools and will also adjust their life strategies according to social reality.

;

;The key factors that affect the supply and demand of the job market are the economic cycle and industrial structure. The feedback from the job market also determines the cost-effectiveness of graduate school. None of the three parties, students, employers, or universities, can answer the question of “is graduate school worth it” alone? In the face of sluggish demand in the job market, both employers and candidates have begun to take action to answer this question: companies have reduced the scale of school recruitment, while candidates have seen a decline in the number of applicants. What is worth asking is, how will universities respond?

;

;Since this century, the number of postgraduate students enrolled in China has increased year by year, from 220,000 in 2003 to more than 1 million in 2020, and now accounts for about 10% of undergraduate graduates that year. Major universities have expanded their enrollment of master's degree students so rapidly over the years. On the one hand, they are of course adapting to the growing needs of the job market. On the other hand, they can also apply for more funds for themselves, charge more tuition fees, and improve various evaluation indicators. In short, it is to strive for more benefits.

;

;In addition to the "reverse incentives" in the job market, the sluggish fertility rate is destined to continue to reduce the number of postgraduate entrance examinations in the future, and the phenomenon of "the merger of primary and secondary schools" will sooner or later spread to higher education. field, this will be a more decisive factor in the future than "candidates choose not to take the exam". In other words, the decline in the number of people taking postgraduate entrance examinations is an irreversible trend. In the future, colleges and universities may face a new enrollment gap of one million levels every year and have to face the severe situation of "competition for existing students". This is a serious issue that colleges and universities need to deal with urgently. challenge.

;

;"Reducing enrollment for master's degrees and expanding enrollment for associate's master's degrees" and "extending the academic system for associate's and master's degrees" are the response plans that some colleges and universities have come up with. In this way, they can not only maintain the original enrollment scale, but also increase enrollment. Collect tuition fees. But the question is, when colleges and universities make a fuss about the academic system and quota of associate and master's degrees, can they really "ensure the quality of training and improve employment competitiveness", or can they just "charge one more year of tuition" or even "delay one year"? "Employment" itself is quite debatable and deserves reflection. Some candidates' doubts about the cost-effectiveness of master's degrees may be one of the reasons for the decrease in the number of postgraduate students this year.

;

;According to the principles of organizational behavior, "organizations will work hard to create jobs for themselves, and employees of organizations will work hard to create jobs for each other." Since an organization has been established, it will do everything possible to maintain its existence, especially The public sector eats up financial resources. Public universities have long relied on taxpayers' money to operate and do not need to directly face market competition. Naturally, they will find ways to maintain their existing graduate spots.

;

;However, changes in supply and demand in the job market and the impact of declining fertility rates will be transmitted sooner or later. The arrival of the enrollment gap has become an irreversible trend. The decline in the number of postgraduate entrance examinations this year is a timely warning to major universities. Comply with the needs of the job market, comprehensively consider social needs, adjust the recruitment plan for graduate students, and better serve the public.

;

;Sign of tragedy

;

;"Compared with before, have I changed in any way?" Zhang Xincheng asked. He was referring to the interview with Southern People Weekly in 2019, when he had just graduated from the Central Academy of Drama. In the past few years, his acting career had become more mature.

;

;Zhang Xincheng has appeared in more types of film and television works and discovered more diverse artistic skills, including participating in reality shows, releasing music albums, and expressing his thoughts more freely in interviews, showing a more relaxed attitude. On the one hand, "I used to think this was not good, that was not good, but now I feel more confident." But he still habitually looks at himself and cares about his external presentation, just like when he was watching a movie on set Playback in the viewfinder, scrolling through audience comments on social media.

;

;The radar of self-examination is always on. Zhang Xincheng will often make corrections or additions to a sentence after finishing it. "When making a movie, you will feel that you are dedicating yourself to art. ... The art here is a false proposition. It is not art in a broad sense, but the art you think you are. When you dedicate yourself to it, you will feel very ritualistic. "Every time the team we work with work hard, everyone is immersed in it, there are no bystanders. Of course, there will be a creator trap for insiders, and they may go to the other extreme, but the process is wonderful."

;

; Family education and schooling experience have shaped Zhang Xincheng’s serious and rigorous character. In middle school, he was taught to be a top student. "My mother always told me not to do anything inappropriate, so I stuck to the rules most of the time." After entering the Chinese Opera, he was taught to be a good actor. He will use an academic attitude to talk about performance, how to speak lines accurately and naturally, and how to design habitual actions to distinguish characters. His rationality and prudence even allow him to design the flaws of characters, because perfect people do not exist. .

;

;But Zhang Xincheng feels that he is not a very self-motivated person in nature. He is lazy and procrastinates. He is also not a person who uses rationality to choose the optimal solution. He is more willing to follow his inner thoughts of escape. After working, like all young people who are just beginning to try to be independent, he slowly freed himself from the shackles of previous disciplines and "opened up" himself through the profession of actor.

;

;Zhang Xincheng, who views himself "rationally", is more "emotional" in his choice of scripts. ;As one of the advantages of purchasing new energy vehicles, the cost of using new energy vehicles has always attracted the attention of car owners. . Recently, some new energy vehicle owners have reported that charging fees at public charging piles have increased since the second half of the year. Does this situation exist? With this question in mind, reporters conducted investigations in many places.

;

;Drivers of operating vehicles are more sensitive to changes in charging fees for new energy vehicles. Master Wei is an online ride-hailing driver in Zhengzhou, Henan, because he goes to public charging stations to charge once or twice a day. His mobile phone clearly records the cost of each charge.

;

;;

;

;Henan Zhengzhou Net Ride-hailing driver Wei Zhenhua: My charging fee has obviously increased. It used to be 1,200 yuan a month, but now it is as high as 1,500 yuan. It has indeed increased a lot. Especially after August, it rose by about 20 to 30%.

;

;The charging fee at public charging piles consists of two parts: electricity price and service fee. Electricity prices have been mainly formed by the market, with "level in and level out" and charging pile operators are not allowed to increase prices. Prices vary in different seasons and during peak, wave, and flat periods every day. The service fee is determined by each charging pile operating company based on market conditions. During the interview, the reporter found that charging fees at public piles have increased not only in Zhengzhou but also in many cities in Henan.

;

;;

;

;A new energy Co., Ltd. Henan regional director Yu Haitao: We charging companies have raised the service fee for primary charging. It has been raised by about 1 jiao to 1 jiao and 2 cents compared to the beginning of the year. So overall, everyone feels the increase in charging prices. The amplitude is relatively large.

;

;Surveys show that the service fees of some charging companies have even increased by around 50%. So, why do they want to adjust the price? Some charging pile operating companies told reporters that the high cost of early investment in charging pile construction and the long-term strategy of "grabbing the market" for low-price operations have put them under greater operating pressure.

;

;;

;

;An electronics company in Henan Wei Hongyu, Operations Director of Technology Co., Ltd.: The main reason for this increase is that as our operations deepen, we find that there is even a risk of inversion in the service fee income of charging stations compared to our station construction costs and our operating costs.

;

;Financial reports of some charging operation companies show that although the company's operating income is rising every year, it is negative profits every year. At the same time, in order to attract more users, operators tend to build high-power charging piles. However, the basic cost of high-power charging piles is relatively high. Some also need to build additional corresponding distribution boxes, and maintenance costs will naturally increase. . Therefore, raising service fees has become the current solution to recover costs.

;

;The cost of using new energy vehicles still has a greater advantage than that of gasoline vehicles

;

;Through interviews and surveys, the reporter found that in some cities, the rising charging costs of electric vehicles do exist. So this situation Does it happen in all cities across the country? Are the cost advantages of buying an electric car still there?

;

;During interviews and surveys in many places, reporters found that the rise in charging costs for new energy vehicles only occurred in some cities, and charging costs in most cities across the country fell into a stable range.

;

;;

;

;Beijing New Energy Car owner: There is not much increase. I have charged at several nearby charging stations. There is not much change. It is basically the same as before.

;

;Shenzhen new energy vehicle owners: The electricity price at this time is 1.27 yuan per unit. The overall cost is not particularly high and it is quite affordable.

;

;Data from the China Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure Promotion Alliance show that from January to October this year, the number of public charging piles in my country was 728,000, and the number in October was 63,000, a year-on-year increase of 50.3%. The increase in the number of charging piles not only meets the rapid development of new energy vehicles, but also makes competition among charging pile operating companies more intense.

;

;;

;

;A smart phone in Beijing Chen Dong, the person in charge of Technology Co., Ltd.: The overall charging price is still relatively low now, because the competition in the industry is fierce. We have more than 40 charging stations in Beijing. Winter is the peak charging season, and the overall cost has not been adjusted upwards. .

;

;Experts said that fluctuations in charging fees in most cities are the result of market supply and demand adjustments, and the quality of increases or decreases cannot be judged absolutely. Most cities have now abolished the maximum price limit on service fees, and each operator can determine the level of charging service fees based on market competition. At the same time, in the face of the issue raised by some netizens that the cost of using new energy vehicles is almost equal to that of gasoline vehicles, experts also gave reporters a calculation.

;

;;

;

;China Electric Power Corporation Liu Yongdong, deputy secretary-general of the federation: For example, for every 100 kilometers of our oil truck, the industry requires about 10 liters of oil. We estimate that it will be calculated at about 8 yuan, which is 80 yuan. Let's look at the tram again. On average, it requires about 15 kilowatt hours of electricity per 100 kilometers. The overall consumption of each kilowatt hour of electricity plus service fees is about 1.5 yuan. So the entire 15 kilowatt hours of electricity is about 22.5 yuan. Even if it is 25 yuan, we Comparing 25 yuan with 80 yuan, it should be said that there is still a huge gap.

;

; Various regions have launched new measures to shape the healthy development of new energy vehicles

;

; In order to ensure a good charging experience for new energy vehicle owners, various regions have successively introduced new policies such as time-of-use electricity prices for charging facilities. The implementation of relevant measures will not only guide car owners to use electricity rationally, but will also be more conducive to the healthy and sustainable development of the new energy vehicle industry.

;

;In September this year, Shandong began to implement a new time-of-use electricity price policy for residents' charging, which subdivided the peak and valley periods and added deep valley and peak periods. During the deep valley period, the electricity price was 0.222 yuan per kilowatt hour, which is the same as The price difference during peak hours is 0.666 yuan per kilowatt hour. By widening the price difference, users are guided to avoid charging during peak hours.

;

;;

;

;Jimo District, Qingdao New energy vehicle owners: Now the electricity price in Shengu for charging at noon is only more than 2 cents per degree. If you go home and have a meal, the electricity will be fully charged.

;

;Not only Shandong, but also Guangdong, Jiangxi, Hunan, Shaanxi and other places have successively introduced time-of-use electricity price policies for residents’ electric vehicle charging facilities. During peak and peak hours, charging car owners need to bear more costs, and During off-peak periods, car owners can enjoy lower prices than before.

;

;;

;

;Shenzhen New Energy Car owner: It is the peak period for charging now. The current price is 1.49 degrees. We usually choose to charge at noon or at night, and the price will be more favorable.

;

;In addition to the continued efforts of government policies, some charging operating companies are also actively exploring new trends in future development. On the one hand, it is necessary to add new momentum to corporate operations, and on the other hand, the charging experience of car owners must also be considered. In order to "stand out" in the market competition, they choose to provide more comprehensive services.

;

;;

;

;A new person in Shenzhen Chen Huanyu, operations director of the energy company: Our service fee is only about a little more than a triangle, which is 5% higher than the service fee of surrounding operators. Our advantage is that the supporting facilities are relatively complete, which solves the driver's dining problem. To solve the problem of rest, we also have a comprehensive service area with quick car repairs, quick washes, and a comprehensive online car-hailing service platform.

;

;At the same time, charging operation companies have also strengthened the level of interconnection and interoperability. In Hainan, the reporter saw that the supervision and operation service platform linked different operators together. There are 165 charging and swapping operators, 63 public battery swapping stations, and 3,358 charging stations connected here. The access rate of the province's public charging pile platform reaches 100%. The construction of the platform not only unifies the payment methods, making it more convenient for car owners to "find charging stations", but also facilitates the monitoring of charging fee fluctuations.

;

;;

;

;Hainan Province Charge Wang Jin, Operations Director of Battery Exchange Network Service Co., Ltd.: Realize the interconnection of pile networks and power grids, promptly report charging stations with irregular charging pricing to pile companies for rectification, and report to the local government management department.

;

;Experts said that both the time-of-use electricity price policy and the active attempts and interconnection measures of charging companies are releasing positive signals and exploring new opportunities for the development of the entire new energy vehicle charging industry. path of.

;

;;

;

;China Electric Power Corporation Liu Yongdong, deputy secretary-general of the Federation: Our country is unswervingly committed to developing new energy vehicles. In this process, including the charging facilities industry, the power industry and the automobile industry, we must promote and eliminate new energy vehicles around a healthy ecology. construction.

;Tang Limei finally lived the fulfilling life she had dreamed of. Waking up early and staying late has become the norm. Getting up at 4 a.m. to go to the airport and returning home at 1:30 a.m. after finishing the day's activities is not an exception. Not staying out overnight is partly to take care of my young daughter’s emotions, but also to satisfy her pursuit of efficiency.

;

;She rarely used it to catch up on sleep when flying, but still raced against time to read and think. Since 2013, she has continued to travel to campuses of all ages, TV studios, events, lectures, forums, and dining tables used for live broadcasts and writing, sharing her deep dives in the Western Pacific with the "Jiaolong" Scientific expedition and the experience of participating in the 34th Antarctic Scientific Expedition.

;

;At first, she only gave lectures as a scientist as a researcher at the Second Institute of Oceanography of the Ministry of Natural Resources. Over the past ten years, she has gradually been dubbed a science popularization expert because of her tireless science popularization and vivid and humorous narration. title. In the past two years, she has won important honors such as Top Ten Science Communication Figures in China, Chief Science Communication Expert, and Female Science Popularization Expert.

;

;On the day of the interview, she spared a few hours, ate a sandwich at noon, and rushed home to prepare for the live broadcast at 4 p.m. Not long ago, she went to attend classes at universities and party schools. The topic she taught was the core of leadership from the perspective of biological evolution, from natural science to humanities and then to philosophy (;This is her usual style;), recalling her hearty smile and said, "There was no urine in the whole process"; then she was also invited to participate in a TED speech, the theme was "If your major is a transfer, you What will happen in the future?"

;

;Experienced the transition from engineering to science (;Undergraduate survey technology and engineering, postgraduate geological engineering, doctoral geology

; span>;), Tang Limei decided to switch his research field to marine geology after listening to a lecture by chance while studying for his PhD. He realized early on that life has no limits and is full of unexpected and unplanned nodes.

;

;With ten years of accumulation in science popularization, she will bring a new book "Exploring the Deep Sea with the "Dragon"" at the end of 2023 to show people a new face of a science popularization writer. The book will introduce the basic knowledge of the ocean (;For example, what is the sea, what is the ocean, how to form;), the five major oceans of the world (;Newly included in the Southern Ocean in 2021;)'s cutting-edge knowledge, personal experience in deep-sea exploration, and the development history of the country's manned deep submersibles, etc.

;

;It took less than half a year to write the book. She was busier than before. She didn't even have time to wash her face after getting up every morning. She said that her days now consist of only three things: work, exercise, and reading and thinking. She has been able to maintain her body shape for nearly 20 years after getting up early for a run. During the interview, she was wearing the team uniform she wore during the Antarctic scientific expedition in 2017, and it still fit her perfectly.

;

;Other than that, there are very few pastimes, and I hardly watch movies. Everything I do must "generate value and meaning." She would refuse without hesitation if asked to travel to the beach. Only when it became a matter of spending time with her children and family would she be willing to do so. "I can't go out to play by myself, but I'm willing to do it with others. It's valuable."

;

;She recalled more than ten years ago when life was not so full. , I still have plenty of time to watch "The Legend of Zhen Huan", and during the period when I went to the Pacific to "isolate", I watched it intermittently nearly 20 times in total. "It wouldn't be so busy then. I would definitely choose to read a book now." It wasn't until 2022 that she turned the content of the TV series into a class, and then she finally let go of the time wasted.

;

;;

;

;Ocean Open Class;(video screenshot/picture);

;

;The lecture content revolves around "Zhen Huan" "Scientific trivia in the Biography", "For example, there is an episode where the emperor went to An Lingrong's place to celebrate her birthday. He was very tired of eating, so he happened to get him some light pastries. Why do we eat dessert after a meal? It's because we The perception of sweetness is at the tip of the tongue, and the perception of bitterness is at the back of the tongue, and then there are other areas in the middle, such as spicy food. Therefore, we can still eat something sweet after a meal because we can feel sweetness at the tip of the tongue at the earliest. ."

;

;"There is also braised pork, which is the Maillard reaction. Isn't the Maillard color popular this year? Maillard is actually caramel color, which is what it turns into after the sugar is burned. Color, what happens between it and braised pork is the Maillard reaction. Why do we need to add sugar? When you make braised pork, you can educate your children about science. These knowledge points are closely related to life; and why do we have oleander powder? Poisonous? I explained its formula, and then what is the most poisonous part of it? Tree trunks, leaves and flowers are all poisonous. Finally, why are these women fighting in the play? These are the backward ideas of feudal society. Let’s talk about it finally. The awakening of women in our new era includes humanistic methods."

;

;She believes that subject segmentation is actually unscientific because "all knowledge is interlinked" and is often lacking in the dissemination of knowledge. Not even one. She likes the title of "Science Communication Figure", "It's quite appropriate. Just like preaching, science is also a cognitive system."

;

;She looks at everything around her with a comprehensive view of the universe and cherishes it. Curious, "Actually, everything is learning. You may have thought it was entertainment before, but with a learning mentality, if you really understand the background, culture or meaning of TV series, movies and other cultural works, it is actually learning.";

;In her spare time during the Antarctic scientific expedition, Tang Limei also watched a few sporadic movies, including the literary film "Sunset Trilogy" series, which she also watched repeatedly. What attracts her is not the romantic encounter between the male and female protagonists, but the social topics that the two communicate and discuss from sunset to sunrise. "In fact, the most attractive thing about it is its topic. It is not that two people are in love, they discuss They are all the destruction of society by developed countries, the infringement of weak countries, the garbage we produce now, the underlying logic of society, etc."

;

;She has also watched some of "Celebrating More Than Years" and she likes it. With time-travel elements, I am also planning to write some science fiction novels next, "For example, two fishes (;because we humans evolved from fish (;), a story of pure love that has gone through five mass extinctions, nine evolutions, and then traveled through several lives. ;;徐卓媛：;;很多人喜欢问我怎么平衡学业和攀登，它们确实很难平衡，但如果真的热爱，你会想尽一切办法去平衡。我现在的高中课业任务很重，登山的训练任务也很重，所以我会把自己所有空闲的时间排满，在原有进度上提前学习。 ;

;

;登顶不是成功，回家才是

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;你登顶珠峰的那一刻是什么心情？ ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;我以为自己会很激动，登顶也算是完成这四年来的梦想，但也不知道是因为当时天气太冷，还是高海拔会压缩人的一些情绪，我其实还挺平静的。我记得当时我把包里的旗帜一一拿出来拍照，然后给我妈打电话报平安。因为天气太恶劣了，暴风雪很大，夏尔巴向导催我赶紧下撤，我就想着快点撤回去。当时爸妈建议我在二号营地再待一天，第二天坐直升机撤回珠峰大本营。但我在山上待了8天，8天里一直没有洗澡，也没有网络，这对我来说其实已经到达极限，我就把睡袋和防潮垫直接丢到了四号营地，决定当天一定要返回大本营，所以那天我撤回去用了22个小时。 ;

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;除了不能洗澡，作为女生，你在攀登过程中还遇到了哪些困难？ ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;其实女性相比男性而言在登山的时候有更多不便，比如洗漱和上厕所。但不管是男性还是女性，在山峰面前都是平等的，只是女性要付出更多的努力才能完成这个目标。 ;

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;没有网络的8天里，你除了训练都在做什么？ ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;主要是训练，我们在二号营地适应了3天，然后一直在等三号营地的消息看修路队能不能修到顶。我们运气挺好的，如果当时修路队没修上去，我们可能要撤回珠峰大本营，等下一个周期。其余的时间，我会和登山队的队友聊天、打扑克牌，还要抗高反。我刚到珠峰大本营的当晚吐得厉害，不知道是不是因为在尼泊尔水土不服，休整了大概两天才恢复。后来就我一个人和队友在大本营训练，我妈妈给我打电话劝我撤回去。所以这次也是我第一次在没有爸爸妈妈的陪伴下去攀登一座山峰。 ;

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;那个时候没想过撤回？ ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;可能就是有点犟，想着自己已经吃了那么多苦，登珠峰前要登那么多座雪山，一天到晚地训练，好不容易到了这里，为什么不坚持一下呢？ ;

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;你在山顶打给妈妈的那通电话里说了什么？ ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;我说我登顶了，让她不要担心，我会尽快下撤。妈妈之前一直不太同意我登山，因为这是一项很危险的极限运动。她一直很担忧。 ;

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;妈妈回了什么？ ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;她跟我说登顶不是成功，回家才是，让我注意安全。 ;

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;这么危险，为什么还坚持攀登？ ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;登山学家乔治·马洛里常常被人问到攀登珠峰的原因，他总是回答“因为山就over there".我们很幸运地可以出于喜爱而攀登，但登顶对我来说不仅是为了让世界看到我，我希望大家还能看到我们这一代中国新青年。 ;

;

;人不可能永远停留在登顶的那刻

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;登顶珠峰后重返学校，身边的朋友和同学会好奇你的这段经历吗？ ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;他们会问我在山上看到的风景怎么样。但我没有感受到太大的变化。大家如常上课，我也按部就班地上课和训练。 ;

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;登顶对你现在的生活有什么Influence? ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;其实也没有什么。人不可能永远停留在登顶的那一刻，我也觉得自己不应该太沉溺于登上一山之巅的喜悦当中，后面的人生还有无数的山峰，无论是物理意义上还是其他层面的。我接下来的目标就是乞力马扎罗山，最近要重新开始训练了。 ;

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;但你会因为已经有了一个不错的成绩而压力更大吗？ ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;其实还好。每座山都有每座山的特点，运气也有好坏。对我来说，重要的是去勇敢地尝试。为了完成它，我会做很多准备，如果这次不行，那就下一次。 ;

;

;;南方人物周刊：;;登顶后，你收到尼泊尔国家旅游局的贺电，被央视认证为“中国年龄最小的从南坡登顶的女运动员”。很多人认为这是一种满分人生，你觉得呢？ ;

;

;;徐卓媛：;;确定自己的梦想并为之奋斗就是一件很满分的事情。对我而言，登上珠峰只是我现阶段比较满意的一份答卷，我才十六七岁，接下来的路很长，还有很多份卷子要交。珠峰只是一个途经点，下一阶段我的目标是完成7+2计划（七大洲的最高峰加上南北两极的徒步）。今年底，我将和妈妈一起完成非洲乞力马扎罗山的攀登。这是我7+2计划的第一步。 ;

;Out of curiosity about the three bizarre murders and the murderer’s motives, Wei Shujun read the novel “The Mistake by the River” several times, but still didn’t understand. Feeling humiliated and excited at the same time, he opened the first page of the computer document and read "Mistake by the River" in enlarged font size. Below it were two lines of small characters, original work: Yu Hua, director: Wei Shujun.

;

;He wants to adapt this novella published in 1988. The perpetrators of the three murders all pointed to madmen, but they could not build a complete chain of evidence to bring him to justice, which made both the town and the criminal police captain Ma Zhe uneasy. Writer Yu Hua's parody of detective novels in the avant-garde literature period used violent absurdity as the surface and subversion of tradition as the core. I have sold the copyright several times but have never changed it.

;

;The difficult thing is to find a word that points to the philosophy behind all suspenseful stories. In 2021, Wei Shujun and screenwriter Kang Chunlei entered the second year of their adaptation. After overturning the general direction twice, they were determined to find the word. They searched for two days and two nights, wandering around the house until they got something.

;

; "Bug." He was quite satisfied with this new development. "It is a word born from the progress of information technology. It is a vulnerability problem based on code and the best rational logic. We think it is too accurate. , isn't our "Yong'an Town Story Collection" called 'Ripples of Life', this one is called 'Bugs of Life'."

;

;It was August 2021, and Wei Shujun was preparing to shoot a new film in Northeast China "White Crane Spreads Wings". After work, the crew plays badminton together. However, indoor venues have been closed due to the new crown epidemic, and they are planning to play basketball outdoors instead.

;

;A month ago, his second feature film "The Story of Yong'an Town" was selected for the Directors' Fortnight section of the Cannes Film Festival; a year ago, his first feature film "Wild Horse Parting Mane" was nominated for the Cannes Newcomer Award. As a feature film director, his graduate work "Yanbian Boy" won the Cannes Short Film Special Mention Award. He received critical acclaim when he first appeared on the scene. Industry seniors and critics praised his talents and talents, and were curious about the possibilities he brought to the table. sex. Wei Shujun received attention as a result.

;

;However, the adaptation of "The Mistake by the River" quickly fell into another strange circle. Bugs do not exist alone. To describe rational loopholes and loss of control, the premise is to explain what rationality is. The argument about rationality is a wide-ranging, academic discussion that is energy-consuming and unnecessary. "We looked in the wrong direction again," we had to give up.

;

;By chance, while scouting locations in Hangzhou, Wei Shujun felt that there should be a dream at the end of the story. "The causes of their deaths are not completely connected on a rational level and cannot serve to solve the case. But in the dream, they interlock with each other, as if they are all established, revealing a certain inevitability in a series of accidents, giving people a creepy feeling." In the final version of the script, dreams became the core sequence.

;

;This seems to be his consistent creative approach, which values ​​the true feelings of the creative subject and expresses them effectively in the film. Photography director Cheng Ma, who has worked with him three times, provided evidence: "We basically create based on our feelings."

;

;Cheng Ma and Wei Shujun met for the first time in Shanghai three years ago, and they chatted quite well. . They have many consensuses on the nature and creative concepts of movies, two of which are simple but very important: movies were created to create "realistic illusions" at the beginning, and they should still be so today, and movies may not be the best way to tell stories. It is a medium, but it is a channel for storing and transmitting the creator’s feelings.

;

;For example, regarding "The Mistake by the River", Wei Shujun told Cheng Ma that it was restrained, quiet, and elegant, and that many things happened on a humid and rainy day. This was how he felt when reading the novel. Accordingly, Cheng Ma felt that the images should be consistent with the 1990s, when the characters were wandering and out of place, and geographical features such as counties or towns were far away, not close. Cheng Ma suggested shooting on 16mm film, and they hit it off immediately.

;

;In November 2022, with 45 days left before filming, the crew arrived in Nanfeng, Jiangxi Province, where the filming took place, to make preparations. The actors were busy with their own work. Tong Linkai had to practice splits and back fists. Zhu Yilong wore a leather jacket to visit the local police and gained 30 pounds to achieve an overworked figure. Zeng Meihuizi was also making herself gain weight in order to look like a孕妇。 The crew cooked together, watched movies, and played badminton.

;

;“I think the best state of creation is when all the main creators are relaxed. I don’t like that kind of tense, night-and-night (state) like a repair project, which is very tiring. That is to say, although it is You are working, but you still have your own life order, and you still retain your pursuit of beauty and passion for life." Wei Shujun said.

;

;He often carries a film camera with him - the crew has a total of more than 20 film cameras, and even a darkroom for developing black and white photos - to capture the daily life of the crew. There are more saved in the photo album on his mobile phone. When he opens it and looks through it, he sees friends meeting, travel scenes, rivers, trees, and the sea. “It seems to have some kind of ability to leave time behind, making you think of it as a pleasant time.” In the afternoon, a happy state."

;

;Relaxation is rare. What is also rare is that, in Cheng Ma's words, Wei Shujun places a particularly high importance on creation. "As a director of his age, he can actually withstand a lot of pressure. We have to shoot smoothly, but many people ask us what to do with the scenes and what to do with the actors' time. For example, a certain role has many scenes, but the actors can only come for 10 days in total. , the usual approach of the crew is to focus on filming all his scenes in these 10 days. But Wei Shujun feels that smooth filming is of great value to his creation, so he will give up scenes that cannot be matched by actors or at inappropriate times."

;

;Kang Chunlei also said: "I think he has an almost intuitive ability to control the scene. I always told him, you shine on the scene."

;

;Also Once, Wei Shujun changed his character's name on the spot. In the novel, Ma Zhe's subordinate is Xiao Li, a young man who takes the initiative to report case analysis from time to time. So of course Tong Linkai’s name is Xiao Li. After a few days of filming, Wei Shujun suddenly said, thank you so much ; ("Thanks" means shit);, don't call me Xiao Li. Just call me Xiao Xie. Wei Shujun greeted other actors and revised his lines. The printed police officer ID card of Xiao Li was re-attached. Tong Linkai's role became Xiao Xie.

;

;But to be honest, the feeling at the scene was not that wonderful. Wei Shujun's own version is: "Imagine that when you were in school, you had to sit in the classroom at 7 a.m. every morning to study early. On the way from home after breakfast, you felt that you were still waking up. When you got to class, you thought about writing yesterday's homework. No, I didn’t write it, so I wrote it quickly. After I wrote it, I felt very at ease. I started to think about going to the canteen to buy something to eat during recess, and then I went to the actual class to listen to the teacher. It was the same on the set, everyone was here, Shui After brewing it, we started drinking water. We walked around the scene and the actors were almost done. Then we discussed the scene and confirmed our schedule with the photographer. Everyone prepared individually and then started to prepare for shooting. If something didn’t feel right in the first two days, Adjust it, and it feels good. If you take a few more shots, it will be time for lunch. It really feels like this."

;

;"There is a slope every day, and you have to climb up a slope. You have to crawl over to get to that position."

;

;"The Mistake by the River" was completed accurately and efficiently, and was shortlisted for the "Un Certain Regard" section of the Cannes Film Festival. Five months later, it won two honors: Best Film and Cinephile Choice at the Pingyao International Film Festival. After another four days, it was released nationwide.

;

;At the end of the film, there was often chatter in the theater. Wei Shujun used a long dream to allow Ma Zhe to reveal himself in order to resolve his own uneasiness and chaos. The dream was clear, coherent but illogical. After witnessing everyone's death by the river, Ma Zhe sat on an old cinema seat and saw the director on the big screen holding a ping pong ball with the number 3 printed on it, shouting at him. ——Ma Zhe! Third class merit! In this shot where conjecture and prophecy overlap, thousands of ping pong balls roll down from the bottom of the screen and swarm towards Ma Zhe.

;

;Everyone was very excited during the shooting. After taking one shot, everyone picked up the thousands of ping pong balls while shouting "One more, another one".

;

;At the end of the show, the audience was full of doubts and endless interpretations and comments about the film, forming multiple dreams outside the screen, a kind of "rationality and irrationality, the combination of the viewer and the viewer." effect". From this perspective, Wei Shujun's initial uneasiness when reading the novel, his exploration of the creator's intentions, and his several elusive moments during the adaptation were all conveyed to the audience. We think we have the answer, but in fact we have the illusion of an answer.

;

;"I am not too obsessed with pursuing the truth in life, because I feel that it is difficult to find it." Cheng Ma said that this is another consensus between him and Wei Shujun that the truth is difficult to find, "the so-called The fate of your life is a random existence. You can only see its existence and don’t know the truth behind it."

;

;The slight existentialist tendency of "The Mistake by the River" is just that Back to "existence precedes essence", or in other words, "back to the thing itself". Just reiterate one point, "I believe that I ;(creator); has determined the sole right of interpretation, and the audience must accept this interpretation Right, this is the biggest paradox."

;

;After the movie was released, Wei Shujun sent a message to Yu Hua, saying that it seems that we did not use a movie to write annotations for the novel, but used the movie to write an annotation for the novel. Thoughts after reading. For a while, the two of them were keen to share with each other the audience's various interpretations of the movie, including a test paper on "Who understands the movie "The Mistake by the River" better, Yu Hua or me?" After Yu Hua finished, he showed Wei Shujun his score, which totaled 40 points.
